# relaxed
[<img alt="github" src="https://img.shields.io/badge/github-grey?style=for-the-badge&labelColor=555555&logo=github">](https://github.com/dimpolo/relaxed)
[<img alt="Crates.io" src="https://img.shields.io/crates/v/relaxed?logo=rust&style=for-the-badge">](https://crates.io/crates/relaxed)
[<img alt="docs.rs" src="https://img.shields.io/badge/docs.rs-relaxed-blue?style=for-the-badge&logoColor=white&logo=data:image/svg+xml;base64,">](https://docs.rs/relaxed)

Wrappers around Atomics that always use `Ordering::Relaxed`

```rust
// instead of:
use std::sync::atomic::{AtomicBool, Ordering};
let atomic = AtomicBool::new(false);
atomic.store(true, Ordering::Relaxed);
assert_eq!(atomic.load(Ordering::Relaxed), true);

// you can do:
use relaxed::RelaxedBool;
let atomic = RelaxedBool::new(false);
atomic.set(true);
assert_eq!(atomic.get(), true);
```
